qas.question: About how many Japanese emigrated to the Marshalls when it was a Japanese colony?
What was the primary nature of Germany's interest in the Marshall Islands?
What was the primary nature of Japan's interest in the Marshall Islands?
Along with the Mariana Islands, on what island were there more Japanese settlers than indigenous inhabitants?

context: The German Empire had primarily <a1_0>economic<a1_0/> interests in Micronesia. The Japanese interests were in <a2_0>land<a2_0/>. Despite the Marshalls' small area and few resources, the absorption of the territory by Japan would to some extent alleviate Japan's problem of an increasing population with a diminishing amount of available land to house it. During its years of colonial rule, Japan moved more than <a0_0>1,000<a0_0/> Japanese to the Marshall Islands although they never outnumbered the indigenous peoples as they did in the Mariana Islands and <a3_0>Palau<a3_0/>.
